text: Mark Kerr may refer to: ==Military== *Lord Mark Kerr (British Army officer) (1676–1752), British general and military governor, Governor of Sheerness, and Governor of Edinburgh Castle *Lord Mark Kerr (Royal Navy officer) (1776–1840), British admiral, contender for Antrim (UK Parliament constituency) *Lord Mark Kerr (British Army officer, born 1817) (1817−1900), British general *Mark Kerr (Royal Navy officer) (1864−1944), British admiral and Royal Air Force general *Mark Kerr (Royal Navy officer, born 1949), British admiral ==Others== *Mark Kerr (abbot) (died 1584), Abbot of Newbattle, Scotland *Mark Kerr, 1st Earl of Lothian (1553−1609), Scottish nobleman and politician *Mark Kerr (fighter) (born 1968), American mixed martial artist and collegiate wrestler *Mark Kerr (footballer) (born 1982), Scottish footballer
title: Mark Kerr
